press.title: HPE Aruba Networking Introduces High-Capacity Wi-Fi 7 Access Points to Improve Enterprise Security, Address AI and IoT Challenges
press.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) has launched high-capacity Wi-Fi 7 access points through its Aruba Networking division. These new products aim to enhance enterprise security and efficiently manage the increasing demand from AI and IoT applications.
press.content: The Wi-Fi 7 access points provide up to 30% more capacity for wireless traffic than competing products. They include features like AI-powered dynamic power save mode for sustainability and will be globally available from July 2024. The new series also integrates with HPE Aruba Networking Central, offering management solutions as a standalone SaaS or part of the HPE GreenLake edge-to-cloud platform.
